I've been playing connect 4 here:
http://www.checkers.ws/board_games/connect_four_games/connect_four/connect_four.htm

I had not known this game before.  This program beats
me almost every time. :)

To those who want to make ANNs that play board games,
I think the use of mini-max is required for any game
more complex than tic-tac-toe.  This is my somewhat
educated opinion, but I don't think its possible to
play the typical board game just from pattern
recognition.  I have two arguments: 1) is that humans
cannot do it; they must look ahead in order to play
decently, and 2) no one has succeeded with an ANN that
doesn't look ahead.  Even with tic-tac-toe, I don't
thing there has been and ANN produced that plays a
perfect game.

People have used ANNs very successfully to evaluate
the board after looking ahead a few ply.
